news.content:
Gen 5 & QOL Fixes!

Generation 5 is just around the corner and some the new sprites have been appearing in the game's network traffic. The current sprites available now appear in the app, so checkout the Unova Pokemon!

There are also many QOL (quality of life) fixes in this update. If you own an iPhone with a notch you will notice many improvements, while non-notched phones still benefit from the update.

PLEASE NOTE: If you are on iOS and have added the app to your home screen you may need to do so again to see the changes. Just head on over to Pokedex Go in Safari and add it to your home screen again!

Search Updates

The search bar in Pokedex Go has now been revamped! Below is a list of searchable terms that you may now use:

Shinies

You can now search for shinies by searching the phrase shiny. This will show all current available shinies in Pokemon Go

Types

To search by type, simply search the type you are looking for. So if you are looking for water types you would just search water

Moves

To search by what moves a Pokemon has you just have to type @move name. For example @blast burn would show all the Pokemon that know Blast Burn

Move Types

You can also now search for Pokemon with a certain type of move by searching @move type. For example @dragon would show all the Pokemon that know Dragon type moves

Names

As before you can simply search for a specific Pokemon by their name. Searching Pikachu would show you Pikachu

Negating a Search

Any search can be negated by searching the ! symbol before any search. For example, searching !grass will show all Pokemon that aren't grass type

Chaining

Any of the above search commands can be grouped together using the & symbol. For example, searching ice & @water would show you all the ice type Pokemon that know water type moves. Searching @rock & @water & @water gun will show you all the Rock and Water Pokemon that know Water Gun. There is no limit to how many searches you can chain together.

Next Update

The next update will be focused on sorting, allowing you to sort your search results by Max CP, Attack, Defence etc!

Pokedex Go is Back!

I'm glad to say Pokedex Go is back, and should be back for good now! Before the data used in the app was for the most part, being entered manually. This took a very, very long time - however now I have created a toolset to pull the data directly from the game master and other official sources. With this new system I can now update all the app data with the press of a button :D

With updating the Pokemon data now being very simple, I have more time to work on upcoming features. Stay tuned as more advanced search and filtering is on its way along with a much better interface to deal with Pokemon forms!

Alolan Forms are Here!

Alolan Pokemon are now in Pokedex Go! We will be updating their movesets as they roll out into Pokemon Go, so stay tuned!

Pokedex Go Update

Sorry for the delay everyone, Pokedex Go is now back being updated! You will now be able to see the Community Day moves for Charizard along with the upcoming Tyrannitar Community Day.

Alolan Pokemon are also now starting to appear in Pokemon Go, so Pokedex Go will be receiving an update very soon to accommodate these new Pokemon. There are many new features planned, so stay tuned!

Gen 4 is (somewhat) Here!

While an official release of generation 4 may be some months away, you can now preview the stats of all the gen 4 Pokemon! Stats in Pokemon Go are formulated directly from the main series games, so by using these formulas we can very accurately predict the stats of upcoming Pokemon. Be aware that these stats can change, as we've seen strong Pokemon such as Mewtwo receive a nerf.

One thing we cannot accurately predict is moves, so all of the generation 4 Pokemon have no moves to compare (moves will be updated when we start to see them in the game master). You can still however compare stats and cross your fingers for good movesets!

Mew's moves have been updated!

Research is live in Pokemon Go, and so is Mew! Mew has gotten a completely new moveset from what we previously saw in the code. It has the most fast and charge moves of any Pokemon so far! So save up your TMs and checkout Mew's new moves!

Frenzy Plant has been added!

Venusaur's community day move Frenzy Plant has been added to Pokedex Go! It's looking like Venusaur may become the top Grass type in Pokemon Go for the time being! Make sure to check out the updated move for yourself and do some comparisons!

Thanks for using Pokedex Go!

The long awaited native support for Android is finally here! Click on the link below to download the APK.

Pokedex Go Android Download

After dealing with some health issues I am back working on Pokedex Go. I've just updated it with a variety of changes, most noticably the Pokemon sprites are now directly from Pokemon Go!

Currently there is a working native version for iOS, however I have no way of distributing the app. If you know of a way to distribute ios apps for free then let me know and I will update accordingly :)
